text: language notes topic for us wedding
customs part 1 weddings can be truly
beautiful no matter how big or how small
they can also be very different that's
because a wedding ceremony is influenced
not only by the culture or cultures of
the people getting married but also
their personal preferences some of you
may already be married and others may
have no intention of ever getting
married
however weddings are common both in
fiction and in real life so the next
time the topic of weddings comes up in
English I want you to be ready ready to
understand and ready to talk
I should warn you that there is a lot of
vocabulary related to weddings I'll try
to write only the most important
vocabulary on the board let's start at
the beginning with the marriage proposal
proposal is the noun the verb is
proposed traditionally a man proposes to
a woman he proposes marriage it's our
custom in the US for the men to go down
on one knee he professes his love and
then he asks the question will you marry
me
hopefully the answer is yes it's also
our custom for the man to offer an
engagement ring when he proposes
the engagement ring is a gold band with
a diamond the bigger the diamond the
more expensive the ring
in the u.s. an engagement ring goes on
the left hand and it's more on this
finger I don't have an engagement ring
because I got married I got engaged and
I got married in Russia and in Russia
there isn't really a tradition of giving
an engagement ring so a couple gets
engaged we say they are engaged get
engaged
meaning become now they are engaged when
a couple is engaged they're promised to
be married they can refer to each other
as their fiance he's my fiance she's my
fiancee
there are two pronunciations we can say
fiance or fiance both are acceptable in
the u.s. now watch the spell written
this way the word refers to the man if
we add an e the word refers to the woman
but the pronunciation can be the same
engagements in the u.s. can be around a
year why so long because there is a lot
to plan the couple has to set the date
choose the location which we can call
the venue they need to make a guest list
choose invitations make invitations send
invitations there are a lot of details
to worry about some couples choose to
push aside a lot of these worries and
reduce some of the expenses by eloping
to elope is to secretly run away and get
married it's usually a surprise to
everyone so a couple elopes they
secretly get married in the US
probably the most common city couples go
to when they wish to elope is Las Vegas
Las Vegas has small wedding chapels that
make it relatively quick and easy and
considerably cheaper to get married in
the u.s. weddings can be very expensive
traditionally the bride's family pays
for the wedding
who is the bride the bride is the woman
getting married the man is called the
groom sometimes you'll hear the word
bridegroom so again as our custom for
the bride's family to pay however today
sometimes the couples saves money and
they pay for their own wedding so new
traditions are coming about one of the
biggest expenses of a wedding is the
dress worn by the bride we call it the
bridal gown it's white that's our
tradition and she also wears a veil to
cover her face traditionally the gown
also has a train that's a long piece of
fabric that trails behind the bride as
she walks a traditional wedding gown
looks very much like this I just may
show you a picture of my own gown at the
very end of this lesson
the bridal gown is not the only special
piece of clothing the groom wear
something special to a tuxedo or tux for
short that's a formal suit for a man
however the bride and groom are not the
only people in the ceremony all the
people who participate in a wedding
ceremony are called the wedding party
wedding parties can be large wedding
parties can be small
after the bride and groom the two most
important people are the maid of honor
and the best man let's start with the
best memory the best man is chosen by
the groom it's a close friend or close
relative the best man stands beside the
groom at the ceremony at the front the
person who officiates or leaves the
ceremony stands in the center this
person could be a judge a priest rabbi
and minister that person stands at the
front and next to him is the groom next
to the groom is the best man the bride
also chooses one friend or close
relative to be the maid of honor
the maid of honor is there to attend the
bride the bride walks down the aisle
that path that leads to the front as she
walks down the aisle the bride holds a
very beautiful bouquet of flowers when
she reaches the front she hands the
bouquet to the maid of honor sometimes
the bride can walk down the aisle by
herself but it's customary for the
father of the bride to give the bride
away that means he walks down the aisle
with his daughter and then at the front
he presents his daughter to the groom
the person officiating asks the question
who gives this woman in marriage or who
gives this woman in holy matrimony
the father of the bride answers I do
and then he presents his daughter to the
groom there are more people in the
wedding party let's talk about that next
this is the end of part 1 please go on
to part 2
